column3: NEW YORK (Reuters) - Stocks looked to open higher on Friday  with oil prices below $50 a barrel, while technology shares try  to extend a three-day winning streak of ending positive as the  fourth quarter begins on Wall Street.

column2: Update 1: IMF reflects on global economic growth
column3: In its global economy outlook the International Monetary Fund predicted worldwide output to lift 5 despite of worries about high oil prices.

column2: Stocks Seen Weak at Open; Oil Higher
column3: NEW YORK (Reuters) - Stocks look to open flat on Monday,  with oil prices moving higher and the dollar holding near  record lows.
